title: Is anyone else listening to music and it seems slower than usual on the radio? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is possible (though unlikely, given the lack of live phone calls on music radio stations today) that you are hearing the radio station’s profanity delay “ramping-up.” With the exception of very old units, radio station profanity delays have a feature designed to make them almost undetectable to listeners. The feature works as follows—when the delay is started up or comes out of being “dumped,” the audio that comes out of the delay is subtly “stretched out” in time. The listener, at first, hears audio that is live, but gradually, a time lag develops between what comes out of the station’s studio console and the instant at which listeners hear that audio. Eventually, the audio coming out of the console does not reach listeners until 7–10 seconds later.
Your perception of time has changed, you are less self absorbed than you would be listening to your own recordings. Speed of playback won’t be hardly any different (no really).
